author: ghassann555
title: Afro-Asian youth connection
description: With the rise of blockchain and global connection, more connection is needed that connects Africa and Asia, specially through ICT & culture. Cardano could help Asian and African youth to collaborate.

f6_assessments.q0: Whilst the idea of getting young Asian and African people involved with Cardano is great the proposal needs some more details. Their proposed solution does lack some information and could be improved by adding a small summary of their plan or what tools or way they will reach the goal of more adoption in Africa. The proposer/s stated that one of their risks would be unfairness in a selection process and then that the solution would be to make the process fair. Adding some more details to how it will be fair and how the process will happen would be a good addition to this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer/s have done a good job with their budget breakdown and have clearly explained what each part of the $75 000 is for. Their plan has some detail to it but some more dates and key milestones would make this plan better. A good addition to the proposal would be how they are going to recruit people and how they will market for their online and offline conferences.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be hard to audit the success of the proposal as there isn't any measurable goals that the proposer/s have set out. The proposer/s stated that they will have feedback forms which will be a good way to measure the progress. Their definition of success is "a healthy community with active members" though this may be hard to achieve as there are no targeted goals for their success.

f6_assessments.q0: We all know the goal set in the Challenge is to grow Africa, grow Cardano. This proposal with the connection of Asian - African youth will indirectly solve the goal set in the Challenge. The team also identified the issue that needs to be addressed, which is to strengthen youth cooperation between Africa and Asia. It is also a cultural exchange between the two continents. I think this is beneficial for the development of Africa, although the benefits are not immediate, it will have a long-term impact and tend to be of spiritual value. Specialized communication platforms and global conferences both offline and online will be held via the Cardano blockchain. This adds value to the Cardano ecosystem both now and in the future. Specifically in the future, this proposal can scale up to create youth connections between all continents (that's my thinking). Then the exchange of cultures and ideas will become strong between all continents. It is especially beneficial for Africa when they can absorb new things and advances of the world. What I want to suggest to the team here is that the team can better explain the contents of the exchange between the two young African and Asian - with clear benefits for the community to understand better. about the impact of the proposal. From there, the community will accurately determine the impact of this proposal and have the most standard assessment. I agree with the impact of the proposal but I apologize to the team for considering my comments to further improve the proposal, especially when it comes to practical application. I vote 4 stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
According to the presentation, the proponent has experience working in several global Youth organizations with leadership roles for 10 years and has been working with Seeds for the Future. This partly makes the proposal feasible. However, the team mentioned the names of 3 core members, but I did not see attached documents to prove it and did not see links to social networks to clarify the publicity of these members' identities. This will make the community and PA doubt the feasibility of the proposal and reduce the credibility of the team. My advice to the team is that you add the identity and background of all members as soon as possible. We all know that specifying the name of the number of members as well as publicizing the identity of the team members is important to prove the feasibility of the proposal. That's why I expect the team to work this out quickly.
Regarding the budget, the presentation is quite sketchy. The budget is broken down into categories but it doesn't seem right to the goal because the team failed to demonstrate the adequacy of the amount requested from the Catalyst fund. I would like to emphasize the role of public budget analysis, which plays an important role in demonstrating the feasibility of the proposal. Hopefully, the team quickly adds a more thorough analysis of the budget and reasonably attaches the amount per job. That's my advice on the budget. If the Catalyst funding has not been received, will the team continue to implement the proposal? Is organization funding available from youth organizations? This question should be answered or presented to the community so that people can better understand the feasibility of the proposal.
The team has a plan and how to implement it, but I consider it a sketchy representation. You only provided a list of things to do, not a specific analysis to better demonstrate its feasibility for the community. I continue to advise the team to analyze carefully the plan and how to implement it to increase the persuasion of the proposal's feasibility.
With the resources needed to make it happen, I don't know of any other members other than the three key members of the team that was originally named. Certainly, to carry out such a continental proposal, the team needs to have more than 3 members, maybe collaborators from youth communities to support the work. Unfortunately, I did not see the team mention any other members with relevant documentation. Thus, it is difficult for the community to trust the prestige of the team. At this point, I would like to note that the team should supplement the list of personnel to implement, this is extremely necessary to confirm the feasibility of the proposal. Have you ever thought about hiring outside experts to suggest better practices? Of course, depending on the actual situation of the implementation of the proposal, the team may consider whether to hire an expert or not. But for me, hiring an expert has a huge advantage in that the team can interact with the best people in the world who specialize in their expertise, from which you can learn a lot from them. (experts).
Technical and technological aspects: Although introduced in the proposal to use blockchain technology, the team was very sketchy in presenting and explaining how this platform applies in the proposal. I think this is a shortcoming that needs to be filled in immediately because the technical and technological factor is key in connecting Asia and Africa, especially the application of today's advanced technology, the Cardano blockchain. Not to mention whether the team thought about releasing the project's NFT? Or other advanced features such as smart contracts closely related to the Cardano blockchain platform?
The only thing that satisfied me in showing the feasibility of the proposal was that the team raised the risks associated with the implementation. It includes the risk of government officials, claims of unfairness, and connectivity problems that will occur in some countries. That is, I have not mentioned other potential risks that will arise in the case of insufficient human resources or insufficient financial resources.
In summary, I feel the team needs to have many additional points to confirm the feasibility of the proposal. Notes on additional comments have been provided by me in the form of advice. Hopefully, the team will continue to perfect the proposal so that it can be effectively applied in the future. I disagree with the feasibility of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones associated with time are almost not shown in the proposal. This greatly affects the transparency and auditability of the proposal. It inconveniences the community when the audit evaluation makes the community more suspicious. Why don't you time add specific timelines and milestones to the proposal? Because without it, the proposal would be greatly affected by unclear transparency. Performance indicators such as KPIs or global human rights indexes are also not shown. Key metrics are also absent. These are major disadvantages in terms of transparency and auditability. We all know that KPIs and key metrics are an essential basis on which to accurately evaluate whether the proposal is implemented transparently and effectively. Therefore, I continue to advise the team to try to understand and add indicators to increase the transparency and auditability of the proposal. While the definition of what success looks like in this proposal is just a healthy community with active members. Does the team think about other indicators such as: How many young members from different continents participate in the exchange, etc...? Throughout the proposal, the problem described seems to be easy to understand with a workaround, but with careful PA - vPA, they will probably be more demanding on how to describe the problem - solution. must achieve depth and thoroughly solve the problem. All of my advice is positive and I want to contribute to the improvement of the thesis every day. I look forward to consulting with the team to improve the current proposal. I strongly disagree about the transparency and auditability of this proposal.

When you are asking a community to fund your concept for $75,000 you really need to answer all relevant questions, pertaining to the Challenge. As a PA I hope all proposals get the same diligence by the Proposers, no matter the dollar ask.  First you should state and then explain what your proposal is for so the PAs and the voters can understand, and it should be relevant to the Challenge it is in. f6_assessments.q1:
The first step take in assessing a proposal for its Feasibility of success is to look at and check the credentials of the team leader and any team members listed. When they cannot be verified or the organizations they state they have experience with, I flag the section for a deep dive. I look at the Catalyst registration to see if they have been around for awhile and if they are following any other projects. This proposer list themselves as a teacher and marketing professional, only follows this idea and has been on Catalyst since Feb 22. There are no other links or feeds to the proposer or the two other team memebers listed. No possibility of verifying or Doxxing.
----------------------------------------------------
I then look for an action plan, roadmap, ect for detail and what their budget looks like. This proposal really has no detail of plan and the budget detail copied and pasted is: "    Platform build 20000
Conference fee 20000
 Invitations 5000
Travel facilitations of participants 10000
Allowances for the period 10000
 Contingency 10000.
My only comment is somewhat Sarky, but who is getting invited for a 5K ask?
====================================
Due to lack of verifiable information, lack of detail and missing information my Assessment of the proposal is a 1(strongly disagree this would be successfully implemented) star.
f6_assessments.q2:
In order to have an audit trail of the $75,000 the proposal asks for there needs to be metrics that are quantifiable. These could be in the form of KPIs, dollars spent and accounted for what was received. etc. The audit statement for this proposal was lacking any measurable metrics and was stated as follows:    "The measurements of our project will be the community and active participants Feedback forms will be distributed to have follow ups". To proposers I suggest you need to be accountable on how you want to invest the communities money.
======================================
My assessment is this is a 1 (strongly disagree it has identifiable measurements of success) star.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies problem that needs to be solved and clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. Two things that are very important in this proposal is they focus on young people, who are very creative and strategic, and also connection or networking. I can't be more agree that to educate and connecting young people can be very beneficial to the ecosystem. My main concern for the proposal is the goal of the networking platform. It is good to unite them, but what are the purposes? Are there any educations that will be given to them? Are there any integrations with developers or Cardano's Africa/ Asia communities? A group without clear purposes won't be strategical to move forward. Key metrics and goals of the proposal should be sharper and shown the benefit for this Afro-Asian networking project.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan need to be more details: how long this project will be, what are the monthly plans, targets and when the team could start to bring value to the ecosystem. The budget also need to be tracked down into details. For example what is the platform build $20.000 is for? How many conferences that will be held with $20.000. What kind of invitation that the team will use so they need to spend $5.000 for invitations. What the team means by allowance for the period $10.000 and the cost of contingency is too big $10.000 without detail explanations. The proposer need to be more strategic and purposeful, so that the fund could be used in an efficient way and bring benefit for Cardano. The time table is unclear and the team need to include their Linkedln link so the community could check their reliability to run such a big project with big fund.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer need to be more specific with their success measurement. It is very unclear to write down that the purpose is to have a healthy community with active members. What the proposer mean by healthy community? What are the parameter to say that they community are active? To bring values to Cardano community, it needs more than to have a healthy and active community. The community need to be educated and know about Cardano and the technology. Second, the team need to have an accessible public channel for delivering regular updates to the community for auditing progress. This public channel can help the team to be accountable with the community that will vote and guide this project if this is funded.
